text: Darcy Henry (1932–2004) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s. ==Playing career== Henry was from Tamworth, New South Wales, and came to Eastern Suburbs as a teenager in 1951. After the 1952 season, Henry moved to play with both Temora and Forbes and represented New South Wales and Australia in 1955 & 1956\. Henry returned to Sydney in 1956 to play with Western Suburbs and played four seasons with them including the 1958 Grand Final.Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players. 1995 () Henry is listed on the Australian Players Register as Kangaroo No. 314. ARL Annual Report 2005, page 54 ==Death== Henry died on 27 November 2004 at Manly, New South Wales, aged 72.
